skill.name: error-memory
skill.description: Use when: making a mistake, breaking build/tests, realizing wrong approach, misunderstanding requirements, using wrong patterns, forgetting conventions, receiving correction from user, unexpected behavior, or any error situation

skill.author: Aceek

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation. No executable code, scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or external command execution exists. The 21 static findings are false positives caused by the analyzer misinterpreting markdown syntax (backticks for inline code, table syntax, YAML frontmatter) as code patterns. All 'weak cryptographic algorithm', 'external_commands', 'network', and 'system reconnaissance' detections are benign documentation text.

content.user_title: Remember errors to avoid repeating mistakes
content.value_statement: Claude sometimes makes the same mistakes across conversations. This skill helps document errors as they happen so future sessions can check and avoid repeating them. The result is faster, more accurate assistance with fewer corrections needed.
actual_capabilities: Categorizes errors by type (technical, context, comprehension)
Analyzes root causes instead of symptoms
Formats errors into reusable rules for future reference
Validates new actions against documented error history
limitations: Only documents errors, does not fix them automatically
Requires manual invocation when errors occur
Cannot access errors from other projects directly
Depends on user cooperation for accurate error classification

use_cases.title: Debug Faster
use_cases.description: Track build failures, test errors, and syntax mistakes to avoid repeating the same issues across sessions.

use_cases.title: Maintain Consistency
use_cases.description: Ensure Claude follows project conventions and patterns by documenting violations when they occur.

use_cases.title: Improve AI Accuracy
use_cases.description: Build a knowledge base of common misunderstandings to help Claude better comprehend future requests.

prompt_templates.title: Invoke on Error
prompt_templates.prompt: I made an error. Use the error-memory skill to document what happened in .claude/errors.md.

prompt_templates.title: After Correction
prompt_templates.prompt: I was corrected by the user. Apply the error-memory skill to log this mistake and its fix.

prompt_templates.title: Check Before Acting
prompt_templates.prompt: Before I proceed, check .claude/errors.md to see if there are any past errors I should avoid.

prompt_templates.title: Archive Old Errors
prompt_templates.scenario: When error log grows too large
prompt_templates.prompt: The error log has over 100 lines. Archive old resolved errors and keep only recent, relevant ones.

best_practices: Document errors immediately when they occur for accurate memory
Focus on root causes, not symptoms, to create actionable rules
Check the error log before starting new tasks in existing projects
anti_patterns: Waiting to document errors until later (details get lost)
Writing vague fixes that are not actionable
Documenting what happened instead of why it happened

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It is compatible with all Claude 3 and Claude 4 family models.

faq.question: How many errors can the log hold?
faq.answer: The skill recommends keeping the error log under 100 lines. When it grows larger, archive older resolved errors to maintain readability.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, errors.md can be linked from project READMEs or combined with other knowledge bases. The file location .claude/errors.md is standard across Claude projects.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only creates and edits a local .claude/errors.md file in your project directory. No data is sent anywhere or shared with external services.

faq.question: What if the errors.md file is missing?
faq.answer: The skill automatically creates the file with a standardized template if it does not exist. The template includes a legend for error types and a table structure.

faq.question: How is this different from standard memory features?
faq.answer: Error memory creates structured, searchable documentation that persists across sessions. It categorizes errors and provides actionable fixes rather than general conversation context.
